messages.subject: Re: Women Rabbi's
messages.msgSnippet: Women can be rabbi s. . . in fact, I know a couple of them. There is a huge Jewish population here, and the women I know have been Rabbi s for a pretty long
messages.messageBody:
Women can be rabbi's. . . in fact, I know a couple of them. There is a huge
Jewish population here, and the women I know have been Rabbi's for a pretty
long time. . . I am thinking about 20 or 30 years.

I guess where I come from on Dr. Laura is that she has some good points on
certain things and some things I strongly agree with and somethings I
strongly disagree with. She is extremely homophobic which I find so unusual
because I know quite a few Jewish people who are the most accepting of all
religions I have found. So, in my own personal life there are people that I
strongly disagree with on some issues. I try to not condemn the person and
see the good they have to offer to me. I am sure I have traits that others
find horrible and I would hope they would not judge me on that one thing or
whatever things they disagree with me on.

I always find for myself when a person brings out a very stong reaction in
me, then it is time for me to look within because there is something there to
teach me. . . something about myself that I am resisting or disliking or some
other issue. It never fails for me.

living in abundance
lovemary

There are no victims in this world. . . only opportunities


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
